properties.Title: Earthen Irrigation Canal
properties.Descriptio: This earth-lined canal  at Tansoum Village connects to and carries water from a cement canal  to individual families' rice paddy fields.
properties.Desc_long: The main purpose of this canal is to provide water for rice paddy irrigation. The 1,800 m long, unlined canal was constructed by villagers and is connected to a cement canal.
properties.Install_No: Built in 1997. Construction funded by DAFO. Maintenance is funded by local families (see maintenance notes).
properties.Maintenanc: Maintenance carried out by farmer deputy (Mr. Sombathany; DAFO). Each year families provide 150 kg/ha of rice for water and maintenance of pump and canal. Some years families pay the equiv. cash value. Local families contribute labor.
properties.Gates_Open: Deputy of farmer group decides when to turn on/off, but water utilized by surrounding people.

properties.Title: Cement Irrigation Canal
properties.Descriptio: Cement canal near at Tansoum Village carries water from nearby Koutjiew Lake to irrigate the surrounding area. The canal links to an earthen canal that distributes water to individual fields.
properties.Desc_long: Cement canal connects to a water transports water for rice paddy irrigation.
properties.Install_No: Built in 2012. Construction funded by DAFO. Maintenance is funded by local families (see maintenance notes).
properties.Maintenanc: Maintenance carried out by farmer deputy (Mr. Sombathany; DAFO). Each year families provide 150 kg/ha of rice for water and maintenance of pump and canal. Some years families pay the equiv. cash value. Local families contribute labor.
properties.Ownership: Community (controlled by deputy of farmer group)
properties.Gates_Open: Deputy of farmer group decides when to turn on/off, but water utilized by surrounding people.

properties.Title: Cement Irrigation Canal
properties.Descriptio: A 0.5 m diameter metal pipe runs 180 m from a pump on Dan Phon Lake and emptying into a cement distribution box with metal check gate. These in turn supply water to soil canal for rice irrigation.
properties.Desc_long: Cement canals are 2 m across at top, narrowing to a flat bottom 0.3 m in width.
properties.Condition_: Majority of canal is soil and appears in good condition.
properties.Install_No: The canal and pipe were built in 1998-1999. The original pipe rusted through and was replaced in 2013.
properties.Maintenanc: Maintenance carried out by farmer deputy (Mr. Somsanith; DAFO). Each year families provide 250 kg/ha of rice for water and maintenance of pump and canal. Some years families pay the equiv. cash value. Local families contribute labor.
properties.Gates_Open: Deputy of farmer group decides when to turn on/off, but water utilized by surrounding people.
